clinical_study.brief_title: Study of Tomotherapy HD in Medulloblastoma
clinical_study.official_title: Study of Tomotherapy HD in Medulloblastoma

lead_sponsor.agency: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Xinhua Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to improve local control and long-term survival in children with medulloblastoma, reduce the side effects of treatment and improve quality of life.

detailed_description.textblock: The technical advantages of Tomotherapy HD in the radiotherapy of children medulloblastoma (advantages in clinical operation and physics) were transformed into clinical advantages, and the possible mechanisms were explored.

primary_outcome.description: Changes in quality of life were assessed by EORTC QLQ-C30

secondary_outcome.description: from the first day of therapy to the date of disease progression or death from any cause, whichever was first (according the criterion of RECIST 1.1 ).
from the first day of therapy to death or last follow-up

arm_group.description: This arm will be planned by 3DCRT to the treatment of the Medulloblastoma
This arm will be planned by TOMO to the treatment of the Medulloblastoma

intervention.description: Patients with Medulloblastoma receiving Three-Dimensional Conformal Radiation Therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- The patient was diagnosed as myeloblastoma by surgical pathology with definite pathological classification. MRI of the head and spinal cord before and after operation, with definite staging; Radiotherapy was performed within 28 days after surgery.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Previous radiotherapy in the whole brain, whole spinal cord or primary focus; Postoperative radiotherapy for more than 28 days.
